channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Lamp post still not repaired, 17th February
item.description:
There’s a defective lamp post towards the end of Royal Oak Rd (near No39 and No41) it’s been reported and this was before Christmas. It’s still not working, It’s dark and it’s a concern for people walking up the road after work/school/out and about. We have also had suspicious behaviour around resident cars so having no light outside is unacceptable considering we are council tax payers.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Royal Oak Road, Bexley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Deep pothole, 17th February
item.description:
This pothole has been here over a year with promises it would be dealt with. The road being narrow most of the time because of parked vehicles, means it cannot be avoided. This is a bus route with 2 different routs running on it,
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 136, Mayplace Road East, Barnehurst, Bexleyheath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned vehicle, 17th February
item.description:
This car, which is smashed up in the front and undrivable, has been abandoned in the residential car park for a month. This car park is a haven for abandoned vehicles and prevents residents from being able to park their cars safely.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Hatton Close, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet
